definition: to artificially inflate/to bid up (the price)
roar of laughter (onom.)/hubbub/to roar (as a crowd)
to lift/to raise/(of two or more persons) to carry

sentences.english: But he makes clear price gouging will not be tolerated.
sentences.chinese: 但他清楚地表示，哄抬油价的行为是绝不能容忍的。

sentences.english: The store owner always jacks up his prices before Christmas.
sentences.chinese: 这家店老板总在耶诞节前哄抬物价。

sentences.english: Another buyer kept bidding up the price.
sentences.chinese: 另外一个买主继续哄抬价格。

sentences.english: Criminologists studied price-gouging and the breakdown of social order.
sentences.chinese: 犯罪学家则研究哄抬物价及社会失序的情况。

sentences.english: The goods were bid up far beyond their value.
sentences.chinese: 那些货物的价钱被哄抬得远远超过其实际价值。

sentences.english: A speculative frenzy of borrowing and bidding up is at work.
sentences.chinese: 大举贷款，哄抬物价，这些投机行为日渐疯狂。

sentences.english: They banned the forcing up of grain prices.
How to keep government from running up the prices of the things you buy and reducing the wages you earn.
sentences.chinese: 如何防止政府哄抬物价，如何防止它瓜分你的工资。

sentences.english: The manager was charged with jacking up prices and was put into prison.
sentences.chinese: 这位经理被指控哄抬物价而被投入监狱。

sentences.english: That firm was laying on higher prices.

definition: to gain profit (by underhand means)/to exploit/exploitation
rare commodity worth hoarding/object for profiteering
to sell only for a good price (idiom)/to wait for a good offer
to resell at a profit/to speculate
